review: Avoid the Chimi Fresco, it's pretty tasteless. Other than that it's a nice place with good service

This was the worst place. I ordered a blue moon shake and it came back to me with chocolate...... I asked is this chocolate with Jameson and Guinness? I pointed to the menu and said its suppose to be vanilla and orange flavor. He said, "I dont know why is says that"  Whaaa? you're kidding me? Wow.  It took forever to get our fries got our meal before the fries. No sauces and totally ignored us.  No tip sorry.

We were traveling through and stopped for lunch on Labor Day.  The bar side was not busy, so we sat down at an empty table.  We were not acknowledged when we walked into the restaurant (which we know, from previous experience with Red Robin employees at other locations, they are expected to greet all guests when they come in AND when they leave).  The server in the bar did not acknowledge us for at least 8 minutes (and even then, only when we flagged her down).  It took her quite awhile to come and get our orders, and even longer to get our food (it was at least 20 minutes from the time we ordered, to the time we got our food, and we were there AFTER the lunch rush).  Even then, both of our burgers were wrong.  We didn't bother to send them back since we'd been waiting for quite awhile by that point.  When we left, we were not greeted on the way out. We won't be returning to this Red Robin location.

Your typical burger joint with a ton of different options for burgers. Its the same as any other red robbin. Nothing really spectacular and nothing really bad bad. The nachos I would avoid. Its very meh. Just a mess of cheese, meat, and guac, not worth the price.

This is my favorite location when it comes to customer service out of the five Red Robin restaurants on Eastside I have visited several times (Factoria mall , Redmond, Bellevue Square and Bothell). I generally like Red Robin chain for a quick burger and delicious sweet potato fries. I like that they can modify everything for vegetarians, vegans, gluten free etc.  I have been to this location several times because I used to live in the area. Great place to grab a burger at! :-)

We've visited this restaurant just today and had a very worst experience. My wife and I being vegetarians ordered for NachOMG (Nachos) without chilli. Waitress named "Vasi" has served nachos WITH chilli. My wife was eating them and suddenly when I looked at her plate and realized there was chilli on the nachos. When I confronted the waitress she was very rude and said "OK I didn't check". It may not matter to these kind of stupid waitresses but for people having emotions about not eating meat will definitely get hurt. I'll never go to this restaurant again and encourage my friends and family to not go here as well. WORST EXPERIENCE and ARROGANT WAITRESSES.

One red robin = all red robins. Red robin was one of my favorite restaurants as a kid. Just a dream for the picky eater who wants kiddie food like plain cheeseburgers fries milkshakes and crayons. Red robin hits the same spot for me as an adult, and there are more complex choices im realizing as far as the "Gourmet" burgers go.  There really aren't any flaws with red robin- they've got it down. Your wants and needs will be met always, if not on the first try then on the second. Red robin is reliably good no matter the location. Red robin. I don't eat beef hardly ever, but as far as chicken burgers go, red robin burgers are just as good if not better than competitors. I think they're really yum. And the red robin steak fries are so nice simply because of that magical seasoning and the wide scope of dipping sauces, with new ones popping up all the time- garlic aoli, sweet Thai.  We ate in the bar a few nights ago, the bartender was sweet! Liked him. Left red robin full and happy. Red robin red robin red robin red robin

I enjoy eating with friends in the bar and always have excellent service. In the summertime the patio is a good spot for a happy hour cocktail. Yes it is a chain, yes you can get a fancy $20 burger in downtown Seattle or Bellevue, but l love the friendly affordability and that it is a welcoming environment.  Bottomless fries!!  Free burger during your birthday month (when you sign up with enough notice for the Royalty club, lots of freebies and deals)!

It always fill my heart with joy whenever I encountered nice service. For this particular visit, our server did an outstanding job. Swung by here for a quick dinner and surprisingly, at 5pm ish, there were plenty of seats out in the restaurant and in the bar. For the bar, it was open seating. My friend and I sat in the bar and overall, both of us had a pleasant time here. For food, we ordered: the pub mac and cheese, the bees kness (aka chicken and waffle sandwich), strawberry freckled lemonade, and some cheesy/spicy fries (forgot the name). For the fries appetizer, it was like eating a mini nachos with fries instead of chip. Loaded with a ton of cheese, bacon and some Jalapenos, this will definitely fulfill any immediate hunger you may have.  As for the mac and cheese, this dish was alright. It's cheesy but nothing too outstanding. As for the bees knees, the waffle is done Belgian style where it's super sweeeet. Combined with waffle with a slab of crispy chicken and bam! A mini sandwich awaits you. Personally, I found the dish to be too much for me but it was fun to try something different on the RR menu. For service, our server was on point. From delivering re-fills of our drinks without us asking to making sure everything went alright, I really do appreciate our server's effort in making this a pleasant dining experience.  This is definitely one of the best RR places I have been to in a long while :)

Disjointed service. Nobody took our order for 20 minutes after we sat down. Food came out, but no silver Ware or napkins came out. We had to flag somebody else in both the situations to help us. They put our order on a wrong table 2 times and exchanged the desktop touch screen machine two times. Burger was tasty. Food was consistent. Side of Apples came out with some wierd gooey stuff in it. Pointed it out. Waiter said, manager will come talk to you. But what happened was, we got a new check with the  amount reduced by 1.99 for apples. We didn't have a chance to give feedback in person. So posting this review. Hope we had a chance to talk to somebody and we did not have post this.

I ordered via phone for a to go order.  I was told 17 minutes - okay no big deal.   I went in about 15 minutes.   First of all, I get that they want to get the to go orders out as quickly as possible.   However, who thought it would be a great idea to have the pick up table right in front of doors that open and close.  How is the food going to stay hot (even in "hot boxes") sitting there as people walk in and out - especially with winter coming?  There are food handling rules about temperatures for food. Anyway, I'm standing there for a good 3 or 4 minutes as the dude behind the counter looks at me a few times but doesn't say anything.  He helps 2 gentlemen who weren't there when I walked in and another gentlemen who was there.   As he's running around another lady asks if I've been helped and when I reply no, she says the dude (who was behind the counter) was getting all the to go food from the kitchen.   I wait around another 3-4 minutes as he helps everyone else but me.   Finally, he asks me if I was (not my name).  I say no and that lady walks in and picks up her food.   Then I give him my name, and my food was literally sitting there the whole time.    So, already being irritated, I mention that it has been sitting there since before I walked in to start and how is it going to remain hot if its been sitting out?  He gets flustered and I guess the manager heard and walked over.  They asked if I wanted it remade, but I had already been there at least 10 minutes by that point.  The manager tried to give me the  - its in a hot box - argument.....which sure it was.  It was also sitting right near doors that open and close every time someone walks in and out.  I decided to take the food because honestly I didn't have the time to wait around. It wasn't very hot and it wasn't very good - along with their updated "look" came a distinct lack of customer service and intelligent food handling knowledge.   The manager did not know how long it had been sitting there......sigh.

This is your typical Red Robin. Although older, it is clean and comfortable inside. The staff handled a larger group well and kept the fries well stocked, drinks refilled and was available when needed. The burgers were properly cooked and fresh. No complaints with this. The kiosks at the table made for splitting the payment among friends very easy to pay.

I used to like this place a lot more than I do now. The portion size is so low for a kids meal that they give you about 5 to 6 fries which doesn't match their nutrition info. Being a type one diabetic, this is not good for me. Please make some sense and upper portion sizes to back where they were and keep using it.

Who came up with this great idea??  So unappealing ... the 2-Go orders are placed in a plastic milk carton, the delivery bags, and ketchup sitting in open cardboard boxes ... then I stand there (EACH time, and there have been 3 times so far) for over 5 minutes while the "door" server runs around looking for some way to take my payment.  I'm literally staring at my "hot" food sitting in a gross, plastic milk container for 5 minutes ... when it could at least be in a bag ready to go.  Nope, once the "newbie" door server figures out how to take payment then I get to painfully watch them put the food in the bag and find the utensils.   RED ROBIN YOUR GROSSING ME OUT...Get it together!

Great food excellent service. Our server was Julio he did an excellent job by taking care of us, food was fresh and delicious.  The only reason I do 3 star is because there was not one at the entrance, and we wait for more then 15mts.

Wanted to a sit down restaurant featuring outside patio dining so chose Red Robin.  Was exactly what we wanted.  Ordered chicken wings for appetizer, which was good.  Margarita was delicious.  Friendly, fast service.

What a let down!! $3.69 for a french onion soup in a bowl that is actually a condiment saucer. Not worth it. Stay away from Red Robin! There are so many burger places around Bellevue that serve better food anyway. Booooo!!!

Meh... it's a Red Robin. If you've been to one, you've basically been to them all.  When I visited this particular location, I didn't feel that it was very busy, but the service was only average, at best.  To me, Red Robin is like a fall-back plan; if your top 3 selections don't seem to workout, then you've all always got the good ol' standby- which happens to be Red Robin in this scenario.

My wife and/or I order something here at least a couple times a month. Almost everytime we have to call 5 times before someone finally picks up to take our order. Or they don't answer and we have to come in to order. This past time the guy at the bar could care less and tolde to deal with it. On top of this they screw up my wife's order almost everytime because she is a vegetarian and they 8 out of 10 times get the order wrong or forget to substitute a veggie patty or option. I don't think this is asking too much. I rarely use Yelp and/or use it complain about service. Really disappointing.
Here before a show at marymoor.  They got us seated quickly,  we ordered right away.  Food's great. Jose is awesome!!!
Grabbed the grilled chicken burger, was cooked well and fries were solid as always, plenty of parking as well and good service!

Poor service. If you're going to order something with bottomless fries, know that they give you a small portion of fries. On my last visit it took 20 minutes after I asked for more fries (and several reminders) for them to bring them. By then my burger was long gone. My suggestion is to ask for more fries as soon as they bring out your food.
The worst experience I have ever had at a Red Robin. Only saw our waitress when we sat down and when she brought us our check.  The only time I never finished my food

I have never been a big fan of Red Robin's burgers.  I don't know why, but I just can't really enjoy their burgers as much as other gourmet burger places.  I don't feel like their patties are as good in quality and flavor, and even when they ask you for how would you like the patties to be cooked, they can never make it right.  Everything is almost always well done..  And how does the overcooked patties taste like??  Way too dry and lack of flavor!   Well, that was for the burgers.. Other than that, Red Robin has really delicious fries, which is usually unlimited when you order with the entree.  They provide all types of dipping sauces in which my favorite is the ranch.   They also serve a great variety of drinks, in which my favorites are Chocolate Monster Shake and Margarita.  They can be very pricey, however, the portion is worth it. For the service, I would compliment to the guy at the bar at this location who was taking care of me today.  He was quick, efficient and friendly.  I don't know his name, but it seemed like he was well known by several customers.   Overall, Red Robin here is a solid place, but I can't give it a higher star due to the fact that their burgers don't live up to my expectations.

Ordered a bacon burger from the bar. Was not asked how I wanted it and then they delivered a well done burger with I believe American cheese (I usually like cheddar and medium rare burgers). The cheese tastes highly processed and the burger was one of the worst ones I've had at any Red Robin. Not too pleased. My friend ordered the boneless BBQ wings and said there wasn't very many of them, he did order the half order though. It was mostly just chips. They also took extremely long to bring us our checks. However there were plenty of big HDTVs to watch the NBA Playoffs, which was a plus! Not sure if we will be back though.

Waited for 20 min. Nobody came. Nobody care. So I left.  Well, that's not my first time. And I think it may be my last time. Truly understand that one person may not that worthy to take care of during kinda busy 1:50 PM, close to lunch time. Still. Disappointed. Bye. Sit at table 31. Lighted my "call server" light and left with the menu on the table.

Horrible experiences at every Red Robin, everytime. Caitlyn was so attentive to our little family. Even though we were only table, totally away from her busy section, we never had to wait. This is a huge problem at the other redmond location. Thank you Caitlyn for being an amazing person!!!!!

Waited for over an hour to be seated for a party of 9. Told us it'd be a 20 minute wait. Still not seated yet. Told us to go to Applebees down the street. Obviously don't want us to be here. Worst restaurant ever.

The heat in the restaurant was broken this evening. We sat in a booth by the window freezing with jackets on throughout the meal. The servers said they talked to the manager and kept asking "is it warmer yet?"  No attempt to try to offer us anything in return. I won't be returning to this location.

Just for your information this is a 8 year old girl. Red robin is my favorite restaurant ever because, it has amazing mac-n-cheese plus they serve as many refills of it as you want, for your drink you can also have refills. l  would definately come back.

Red Robin is always a good choice for a cheaper meal. Very very causal and relax. Never a bad choice if you have kids. Its a better option than Applebee's... (Sorry Applebee's) MAC LOVERS: The kids mac n cheese is seriously THE BEST, always ask for the free re-fill!

I sincerely apologize, there was some miscommunications we have already alerted the 2390 148th Ave. N.E. Red Robin as well as their Regional Operations Director regarding your experience. There was a typo in the last message regarding a gift card, we will not be issuing a gift card, that typo should have been taken out of the email sent to you. We have addressed your concerns at the location, we sincerely apologize for the frustration you have experienced regarding our email. This is too much. Terrible company!!!!!

Me and my 2 girl friends had the most uncomfortable experience today at red robin... Every time the waiter came by (blonde pony tail) he would make comments to us about how he was single and so many other pick up lines. For example my friend ordered a kind of complicated order and once I said mine after her he goes , okay now you could swipe right for me (referring to the dating website Tinder). Another time he came up saying his zodiac sign and how he's single for whichever one of us wants to date him. Or another time he was like "I'm not drunk. But I could be drunk when we hangout later". I swear to you, every single time he came to the table he said some kind of comment like this. There is a time and a place for that kind of talk and waiting on a CUSTOMER is not the time for that! This was just so uncomfortable and so shocking. We are just trying to get our food and talk amongst eachother not have our waiter hitting on us every time he comes to the table. Oh and the food sucked btw.  PS. if you are a guy, please do not come up and hit on a girl in a restaurant who's sitting down eating or about to eat. Not the right time. At all.

This Red Robin is one of the best locations I have ever been to. The service is always great and the food is always fresh. We come to this location for all kinds of events - birthdays, post football games, relaxing Sunday... You name it. Places like this deserve to maintain consistent and loyal customers. I appreciate the positive experiences and look forward to seeing you soon!!

Went Sunday afternoon, 10/2/16 at 4:30pm. The woman working the front wasn't at the front initially and then sat as next to a family at a table that didn't even have its own payment device (the tablets found on every table). Received zero service for around 10 minutes despite the restaurant being nearly empty, another strange thing about our seating arrangement. Walked out after zero service was received. Completely inexcusable.
Ordered some BBQ smoke burger thing, came out looking and tasting awful. Service was great though. Drinks are sub par

Red Robin continues to not impress me.  Their menu changes, their prices go up, but their portion sizes go down.  I'm not happy. We stopped at this location mainly due to the close proximity to the hotel we stayed at.  While our server, Mercedes, was wonderful, and one of the best servers I have experienced in recent times, including at other Red Robin's, the issue remains the food.  10 years ago, Red Robin's had a two sided menu, and the food portions were large, the prices were always higher than a standard fair burger at a fast food join, but the value was there.  I always needed a doggie bag it seemed for my burger, and even for some of the fires, which I never needed to order a second helping of their bottomless fries.   Ever since Red Robin's went to a "Applebee's" style booklet for a menu, they are skimping on the portion sizes, and they give you about 10 French fries per serving with their bottomless Fries, making your plate look huge due to the freakishly small serving of fries in a metal cup.  My burger, while tasty, was small.  Much smaller than I remember Red Robin serving in the past.  I got the new special, a "Southern Charms" burger, which was with bacon, fried onions, BBQ sauce, and basically all the "fixin's" you'd want for a burger that has connotations to the south.  It was on a ciabatta bread bun.  In the past, the burgers were larger in volume.  Not this one.  I didn't even have to disengage my jaw to get my mouth around this burger.  The total for the two adult meals, and two children's meals was about $50.00.  No alcohol was purchased, but this is an expensive outing to me for a young family of four.  This is one of the reasons I do not frequent Red Robin's.  The second has been the bad or lack-there-of service, and finally, the portion sizes are too small now.   Overall, the food was disappointing in the portion size and the price.  Like I said, our server was the highlight, and this is not something to take lightly.  I tip based on service, not on the meal.  Read any of my restaurant reviews and it will reflect on how important good service is.  She is easily carrying one of the two stars that I gave for this Red Robin's!  She was busy training someone, but she checked in often, my water never once went dry, and she was engaging with my kids.  She did the order by memory, and did a fantastic job.  If you come here, don't expect much from the food, but ask for Mercedes to be your server.  You will be glad you did!

Service was great and it was busy. The burger looked exactly what the picture looked like and it taste ok wonderful. - 1 star just because there was no milk shake today. Overall I will be back. Better then the red robin in downtown Bellevue.

Getting good service is like winning the lottery.  Our waiter was VERY competitive. Another waiter was taking our order because they were so busy, and he was yelled at by our waiter. Totally unprofessional, we felt so bad for the kid, he was so nice about it. He totally didn't deserve to be treated like that.   I have had maybe one server who kept me coming back but, since they moved on, I stopped coming. I went back tonight in hopes of reclaiming another restaurant, but was throughly disappointed. The food was awful. And don't take that lightly. I ordered a burger and I rang it out, and my basket was COVERED in grease. Talk about unappealing! I also got only 5 fries....... I don't think I'll be coming back here any time soon. Servers are ok, unless you're leaving a tip, they don't care about you. Leaving a restaurant unsatisfied and still hungry isn't the way to run a business. ******Update****** the business owner contacted me, to try and give me a better experience. I gave them my direct into and I haven't heard from them in 4 months. Whoo.   It's disappointing, I used to love that place.

Ah, this is one of the best restaurants I've ever been in.   Besides having a lot of fond memories going to this exact location as a kid and getting awesome birthday sundaes (complete with waiters singing "happy happy birthday" on cue), playing video games in the mini-arcade while waiting for the food, and checking out all the colorful props and pictures in the joint...the quality of the food and service is STILL exceptional. I have no idea what the bad reviews are even coming from. Their burgers are great (the Monster burger with bottomless jumbo fries is one of the best I've ever had).  The tower of onions and other apps are spot-on.  They have a great array of drinks for kids and adults.  And the general atmosphere (thanks to the staff and the decorating) is very up-beat and cheerful. The prices, for a gourmet burger joint, are spot-on.  I've paid a lot more in places that aren't half as good. Hope to go back to this exact spot someday!

wow, i believe last night's dining experience was the worst customer service i've EVER experienced in a lifetime of dining out! there was nothing wrong with the food but the service alone makes our entire family never want to frequent this red robin again. i didn't get the name of the waitress but basically, we had to ask multiple times for everything and wait 15-30 minutes for it, including our initial drink orders (half of which were just water). and when we asked again for something, our waitress never said "sorry" but instead, got snappy with us and actually said "i heard you" twice to different family members. REALLY?!  management, if you read this bad review (which i highly doubt they will), you probably know who we're talking about because i don't believe we were the only ones to experience her lousy service skills. please either retrain her properly or she needs to move onto another profession where she doesn't actually have to deal with people or earn a tip... because she isn't doing so. g'bye.

I've been going to the dirty bird as long as I can remember.  I used to go here for all of my birthday dinners as a kid, and frequented well through college and after (I'm 33 now).  If you can read my last review (from last year) you can see that I still loved my experiences at RR.   That's all changed over the last few months(4-5 visits).  First- the greasy touchscreens cluttering the tables is a terrible addition.  Seriously, like we need another touchscreen in our lives when we sit down for a meal?!  Second- the Redmond location has gotten a remodel, which unfortunately further strips this place's identity and replaces it with sparse walls with about as much personality as a Ballard condo building.  Bring back the goofy wall decorations!  Get rid of the brewpub/upscale look because your menu and tap-list don't stand up to that vibe. As for the food- if you haven't been to a RR in a while, you'll notice less of the traditional burgers, but more of these new "premium" burgers.  At $13-14 a pop, you can get a burger that tastes like what the traditional burgers once did.  Now, you get paper-thin bacon and thinner meat patties on the traditional burgers.  (they used to ask you for your cook preference)  Now they just come out medium and flavorless.   Now, for the saving grace- the fries!  Well, the last couple times I've been in, they were clearly sitting for a long time because they tasted like cardboard but were still sent out to my table.  I had to ask for more fries for everyone in our group, because at RR, even if your burger is ok, you know the bottomless fries are on point.  Not so much any more it seems.  What the hell is going on Red Robin?!  You've lost that personality and ecclectic vibe that made me always feel like I'd leave satisfied.  Now we've got touchscreens, tiered burger quality levels, pseudo-upscale decor, and shotty fries...   Sorry, but I've gotta take a break.  Bring the dirtybird back!

I made a to-go order at this particular location and when I picked it up I forgot to grab the shakes that I ordered.  I didn't realize this until I got home.  I called this location and Stephen took my call.  He apologized (even though it wasn't his fault, someone else gave me my food and I should have checked to make sure the shakes were there) and told me that he'd make them fresh for me when I arrived.  I headed back down and right when I arrived he confirmed that I was the one to pick up the shakes and he immediately went to work.  Just a few minutes later I had my shakes and he notified me that he had reopened my initial order and took the shakes off of it.  He told me they were on the house and apologized again.   He was customer service rockstar.  I will definitely be coming back. Thanks!

I went to Red Robin last night, i snuck away from my table, i asked the bartender on shift  if she could tell my waiter that it was my fiancés birthday ,and asked if they could sing happy birthday to him And she told me she would do that. We ate our meal and then the ticket came. And we paid. I was really excited because this is what Red Robin does. Right? Well no birthday song.  We where leaving out the door, I wanted to let someone know without being an ass. Well I went to my waiter and let him know he offered me ice cream, I said no and thank you. He went and got the manager on site last night, I told him and he said well if you bring him back in we will do that and I told him that would be akward. So when I walked to the door I relaxed the waiter was talking to my fiancé, I did not understand why. Well after we got home, I found out the waiter went to my fiance and said something like oh it is your birthday. Just made things weird because yes it is his birthday month, but yesterday was not his birthday. Ugh.   Well I have a few days left thankfully to do something special for him. But come on Red Robin this is why you are famous for. Feeling pretty let down.  I

Have never been fan of this place, yet going there, just confirmed why. Arrived at 9:30, ordered a couple of salads and a burger. The salad presentation was sad, the waitress dropped some of the salad in our water..  The fries are supposed to be bottomless but they purposely bring them out in a 30mins cadence. It takes 5mins for fries to be ready.. The quality of the food was okay, the service was really mediocre, the waitress didn't care about anything but selling us  desserts.. Kudos for trying but dang, was she pushy.. The manager ran food, she was as mediocre..  Sigh.. I am going to pass on this one..

I have been coming to red robin for about 7 years now. I'm a very loyal customer to them. I was so disappointed tonight when I came in with my sisters to eat dinner there. As we walked in, we asked the hostess named Erica for a table for three. Erica then took us to seat us. We asked if we could get a different table and she looked at us with frustration. We asked if we can get a booth, she told us it wasn't available. We then asked if we can sit anywhere but the middle and she got more frustrated, rolled her eyes and said its your choice honestly, I have to go to the front. She then walked away. My siblings and I were shocked to see the treatment we got. We saw how she was talking to other customers, she was super kind and patient. Needles to say, we are never coming to this red robin to eat.

Taking one star back. Reason being the service here is a bit slow. It can take a while for the food to come out, especially if your group is large. It made sense that they did serve baskets of fries while the rest of the food was still being made. Today, had a Tavern double burger with bacon ($7.99) and an Irish beer shake ($4.59). The double burger is a smaller burger then the standard options, but paired with the bottomless fries, it is more than enough food. Especially if you get an app or drink. The burger was standardly good. Just what you would expect a burger with bacon to taste like. The bacon supposedly had an aioli, but I didn't taste it really. Shame as that would have took this burger to the next level. The Irish beer shake is a limited time drink available now, assumedly to culminate with the upcoming St. Patrick's Day. It is a mix of Guiness, Jameson whiskey and ice cream. Ingredients that can do no wrong. I wasn't sold on the drink at first, but it eventually won me over. Also, it is reasonably priced for a boozy shake. I would get this over a pint of beer. The food here is good. Though the service can be slow. Still I find this to be a great place for large groups to go since the restaurant is huge and the menu is crowd pleasing. Proximity to MS is also a nice selling point.

A guilty pleasure we visit 2x per year.  Great burgs, the steak fried are legendary and the milkshakes are worth it every time.  The bar could use some updating, but love how the embraced the server-less ordering system.  Maybe we should visit more often...

So most every red robin is the same to me. The food is always constantly good. And if anything is wrong usually fixed quickly.  This was my first time at this location. And it reminded me of all the others. Everything came out great and how we asked.  My only complaint is I am not a fan of the new menu.

Wow this place sucks. I've been to different Red Robin locations and this is the worse, they just don't care about customers, we have been sitting for 20 min. We see managers, hostess, servers passing by and seems like we are invisible. 2 tables sat after us and 2 different servers took their order and we keep waiting for our server!!!  After 25 min server Haley notice that we have been ignored the entire time.. She is the only reason this place deserves at least  one star!!!

Growing up, I never had a single bad experience at a Red Robin.  The atmosphere  of the restaurant was lively and fun, and the staff was always super friendly.  I started coming to this location because it's more convenient and every single time I have come, I have had a terrible experience. We always had the same hostess and she always gave my group the worst attitude.  Being greeted by negativity is the biggest turn off. Service is hit or miss.  I've had a few good servers, but I've had many more bad ones.  For the people that provide poor service, it is blatantly obvious that they are just going through the motions to make money.  They do not care about the customers or their experience. The food is consistent which is good.  My only complaint is that you CANNOT advertise bottomless fries and not provide them when the customer asks. It's false advertising.   It's happened every single time I've come to this location, and I would say I've been here about 20 times before I finally gave up on this place.  I see that other customers have complained about the same thing.  I don't know if you have a french fry shortage, but if you don't have the supply to meet the demand, then you shouldn't advertise it.

I stopped in for a solo lunch yesterday.  Was greeted with a smile and hello at the front door.  Decided to sit at the bar to eat. The burger and fries were good, but the bartender who served me was great.  He and the manager were busy treating myself and all the customers around me with fantastic service. 5 stars for the staff. I'll  be back. Thanks!!!

I've been going to Red Robin restaurants since the 1980s. They're a great place to take the family because the adults can enjoy something pretty good while the kids have a good time too. I've been going out of our way to go to this branch (on 148th in Redmond, by Sears and across the street from Fred Meyer), even though we're much closer to the Factoria branch, because they have Black Butte Porter beer. It's not on the menu and newer servers don't know about it, but just explain and be patient and soon enough you'll have it in front of you. The other branches do not offer any dark beer at all. The Factoria Branch used to have one called Irish Death, but no longer. But what brought me here today was the worst service I'd ever seen in a Red Robin. Here's the complaint I sent in: "I've been going to Red Robin restaurants since the 1980s and this is the first time I've complained. The server was friendly and attentive, but there were several problems with the service. I was a restaurant waiter and manager for 6 years, and I was not impressed with today's service.  Here are the problems in the order that they happened:  1) A cup of coffee was served with a large, obvious patch of bright red lipstick.  2) The same cup of coffee was also served without a spoon nor any other way of stirring in the cream.  3) A smoothie drink was served without a straw.  4) A Black & Bleu burger was served without the bleu cheese sauce.  5) When I asked for the sauce that normally goes with the Black & Bleu burger (I have had this excellent burger many times), the server seemed mystified. She came back with cold bleu cheese salad dressing, which was not at all enjoyable with the burger.  6) A child's birthday sundae was served to a 10 year old child without asking nor notifying the parents. That's dangerous; there could be an allergy issue.  7) We had to ask twice for to-go boxes." Their response was a boilerplate apology email.

I joined a gathering of friends at Red Robin. Our server took our order for drinks shortly after we sat down. Because we needed to leave for a meeting in a short time, the server then came around our table for our meal order. Our drinks came in a short time. Our meals came in a reasonable amount of time and was accurate. I ordered the chicken wrap with ranch dressing and French onion soup, both of which were delicious. Our group will be coming back.

As a vegetarian, it's so great to have a burger place that is so accommodating to vegetarians.  Red Robin is a chain, so the food quality tends to be consistent across all branches. I've been to this Redmond branch a few times and the service and food are great.  Great place for a group dinner or to grab something to go.

What a HORRIBLE experience.  I will just rant on a couple of things. Other RR locations have been terrific, great food and customer service. This location in Redmond and particular the management, Ben and team, have a lot to be desired.  Our service on Sept 29th was slow, asked repeatedly for water refills to usually 2-3 servers to get attention.  When we ran our card on the device at the table provided, it didn't work, so we tried again.  This resulted in RR charging OVER $450 dollars to our credit card and resulted in our credit card being FROZEN for fraud.  I asked Ben about this, he said other customers have complained, this is COMMON.  Oh why not DO SOMETHING ABOUT IT?  I was told I would get a courtesy gift card for my horrible experience both in customer service and charges, I DID NOT.  Ben DID NOT apologize to me, he did not admit that RR made a mistake or would rectify. Ben said his system down, he would mail a gift card to me. I never received it. I gave him my address again, no follow up, no return call.    Overall, this location I will write letters, tell friends , family, everyone I can and hope BEN does not retain his job as an ineffective manager, customer service provider.   He told me that he just does whatever corporate tells him, including having a BROKEN customer experience. Wonderful, beware!

I received their response to the WA AG notice, looks like a lawyer wrote it as opposed to a customer advocate, they deny my 'allegations' and claim how they have a trademark on bottomless fries among other things in their defense. I wonder if I take a trademark on flyer of fighter jets, will that make me a genuine pilot ? Talk about failing logic 101. They do not address any of my issues directly and also dont talk about multiple independent people having the same poor experiences on the Yelp page.  Overall they claim I perceived a bad experience so not even an acknowledgement there of their restaurant being poorly run. No mention of restaurant being retrained either. Overall a shitty response from what I can see is a disinterested and indifferent company. Everyone who has problems getting advertised stuff should take them to task and complain to the AG office. WA residents can complain here :
I call made order and pay on phone 10 pm  Arrived around 1035 the sad we are closest  Come back tomorrow not sure why? Need feedback please ASAP

In my opinion Red Robin is the Dennys of the Millenium, they're there. The one and only reason they get a 5 star rating from me, is their secret weapon, Wade! Honestly he's the one that keeps me coming back, he's attentive, and funny. We adore him. That's the reason we go in.  You can only find Wade working the bar area, so if you have children with you, I guess you're out of luck. Besides my favorite waiter, Red Robin has a few other tidbits going for them (again my opinion), their poppy seed honey mustard sauce, it's a go to / must for years. And their raspberry lime - aide non-alcoholic beverage (for those of us who have had alcohol reek havoc on their lives). It's expensive but comes with free refills. If I could suggest to Red Robin a few ideas- 1. Stop giving out balloons, they're terrible for the environment. I recently watched 2 boys playing outside with them (and one boys crutches) pop, pop, pop, and they just kept going back in for more balloons. Did I mention they didn't clean up their broken bits all over the place. I was fuming, and wanted to screm at them. Upon leaving I picked them up, so I knew it was done before they blew around more. So if you could find compostable balloons then ok, but otherwise please stop giving out balloons. 2. Please bring back the mountain high / mile high mud pie dessert WITH peanut butter. Offer both versions if you want.  I love peanut butter. I'm sorry that some people are allergic, but most of those people read the menu and contamination ect. I don't eat meat, but that doesn't stop you from having meat options all over the menu. Just my opinion.
Very slow service soup wasn't hot enough and not even juice in soap poss end of the day but they can say they are out than serve like that

I'm a huge Red Robin fan, but despite having the same menu and decor, they are not all the same. This is my least favorite RR location. The bar for HH is fun, and the waiters I've had in the bar area are attentive, but whenever we've eaten in the restaurant proper, we've been sorely disappointed. In fact, last time we were there, it was so bad, we decided not to come back to this location, preferring instead to hop on 520 and drive the 8 minutes or so to the Redmond Town Center location. Why? Service, service, service. For our family, it's always been slow at this particular site. And the last time we were there, it was SO slow, and when our food finally came out, it was tepid at best.

Ate a late lunch at this Red Robin today, ordered their artic cod sandwich with slaw and paid an additional 1.50 to substitute onion rings for their bottomless fries.  I wasn't impressed, nothing stood out.  It was just okay,  Also ordered an ice tea with lime, got a ice tea with lemon, had to ask for lime again.  Otherwise, the service was good.  Today was Seahawks Touch Down --buy an entrée/burger/salad with two beverages, and get a double Tavern Burger for free.  The patties (although 2) were rather small.  Instead of bottomless fries with the burger, we substituted a salad.  Onion rings were rather toasty--dark brownish--I have had better at the Issaquah Red Robin.  BTW, if you were wondering....If you buy one of their gift cards for 25.00, you get a free 5.00 added, but you can't use the gift card until 12 hours later...Restaurant wasn't too crowded and we got a table right away (2:00PM).  Everything looked clean and tidy.  Plenty of parking available.  On a positive note, the restaurant was not as noisy as other Red Robins.

I like the food.  My rating is mainly for service.  I haven't had a terrible service nor have I had an excellent service.  Sometimes the servers kind of forget you.  Takes a while for refills on drinks or fries.  My group usually consists of 7 or more people.  The restaurant just had a remodel.  It looks good.  They have a wheelchair ramp up to the bar area.  I think that part is part of the remodel.

Friday night and at 6:30 tables are open. Definitely less business than inbthe past.  Good service and still the full menu of terrible choices. (Tasty, just terrible for you.) I had fish and chips. Lots of fish (4 pieces) and it was good quality.  Unfortunately it was only about 90 degrees. Also thin on chips although if I had to vote for one or the other, more fish is definitely the best.

My son and husband went into Red Robin for lunch today.  They ordered a Royal Burger and Mac n Cheese.  When it came time to pay he forgot his wallet and called me to bring him a credit card.  I was busy so I asked if they could take a number over the phone.  It can be embarrassing but the manager was cool about it and took care of the fams.  Thanks!  Good looking out today!

Never got a chance to taste food after waiting 15 minute in an empty Resturant no wait staff and the hostesses where clueless as to that fact that no one cared customers might like to eat. Off to 5 guys
Service was too slow. We waited our order 30 minutes. French fries was too salty. We used to like go to this place . I was dessapointed

While many of the chain restaurants attempt to "jazz" up their menus and fail miserably - Red Robin is getting it right: from non burger options to flexible sides (fruit, salads), to fun appetizers and drinks this place gets my vote. I love their loyalty program that does not demand any "hoops" to jump through to make it useful.

I had a great time with good company. Bar was a comfortable nice setting. Nothing too impressive though. (But it is red robin)  Fried zucchini and mushrooms were delicious. We got the black and blue burger which was SUPER yummy.  To drink I had a martini which was decent, and my friend had a couple margeritas (which were super sweet-but some people like them that way). For how slow the bar was I felt like the drinks took kind of a long time to come out. But I know that sometimes when it's slow it's easy to lag a bit. But nothing too ridiculous.  Service and food and drinks were good. Nothing impeccable but it wasn't a BAD experience. So why only 2 stars? Well. I got my bill and apparently red robin charges for a "double" beverage when you get a martini. Which I asked about and was told that "a martini IS a double". (I have NEVER experienced that-it's a regular drink I get when going out). I didn't want to make a fuss. So I paid for my bill and left and proceeded to call all my bartender friends to ask if that is something they've encountered and all said NO.  In addition for anyone who is curious. A regular liquor drink has 1.5oz of alcohol. A shot is the same. 1.5oz. So a double would come out to 3oz. If I was getting 3oz of liquor in my martini 1)from what I've known to be true you cannot legally serve someone a DOUBLE when they order what is a single beverage. 2)a martini has 2oz of alcohol (which at any other establishment would require an extra dollar or 2 for the 1/2oz of extra liquor. 3) i also recall that you cannot charge someone for what they did not receive. And I did not receive 3oz of vodka. So I would like to know who drank that extra 1oz I paid for.  Yes I realize I went to red robin. Yes I realize this might be an overreaction. BUT it's the point that what they're doing is shady and could potentially be borderline illegal under laws in place by the liquor control board. When it comes to booze. You can't charge someone for what they didn't get.

This red robin was a lot larger than I expected. We had a party of 8 so I called about 15 min ahead and our table was ready when we arrived.  I like that red robin allows for customization of the food, but it's still somewhere I would go to, but not necessarily choose to go to.  Had the chicken sandwich w/ mozzerella and tomato. I liked the burger b/c it wasn't the typical super greasy burger.  Service was fine too.

To start off, I love Red Robin.  They normally have the best overall selection and once in a while, I treat myself to the prime rib dip and the mud pie after.  Around the middle of last year, I decided to have my birthday with family and friends at this Red Robin.  This was probably the worst birthday dinner I have ever had!  The food was mediocre and tasted like it was left out for a while.  I ordered a shake and after reminding our waiter 3 times, I told him to cancel it we were done with our meals.  We also tried to order more fries but not one person got any for the entire time we were there.  So much for Red Robin's policy.   At the end, I spoke with the manager explaining what had happened but he didn't seem very interested to hear this.  In all, we will definitely not come back to this Red Robin again.
Most burgers are great.  Not always asked how I want my burger. Weekend rush can delay the bottom less fries.

Salty food, servers with shirts so low cut it's a "wardrobe malfunction" waiting to happen and tables so close together you get bumped every single time someone walks by. Not an experience I care to repeat.  Even worse, I gave Red Robin detailed feedback on exactly what went wrong with our visit and asked for someone to contact me to help make this right.  I just got a canned response saying they'll use my comments in future trainings. I know I shouldn't expect a lot from cheap chains like RR, but their service and lack of response to customer concerns is bad even for them. Avoid this location!

My friend and I came in for a to go order and our waiter, Stephen, was fantastic! He was very nice and even though he was super busy he made sure to make time for our order even though it was packed. Stephan went above and beyand. Will definitely come back here!

I have to say that quality of Red Robin places in this area have gone down. From last 3-4 experiences, I felt that the 148th Ave Red Robin is better than the Redmond Town Center, but our latest visit prove otherwise. The service is slow and not courteous. We asked for fries (they are bottomless remember) to get started early but the server listened and didn't get fries until our onion rings and food was on table. Neither the boca patty nor the chicken on the Ensenada chicken platter were well done.  The fries were hot and their seasoning is still good :-).
Decided to give it another try today. Beer was terrific (Elysian IPA) and the Tavern Double was perfect. My last review wasn't very kind but today was good. Noelle is an outstanding bartender!!!!
Great food, great staff, can't go wrong! Sweet potatoe fries...so bomb!  Also the boca patty is vegan and the veggie patty is vegetarian for all those health nuts out there :)

Pretty poor experience this afternoon. Was in after the lunch rush, and sat in the bar; there were maybe 10 other people in the bar, i.e. not crowded. Service was very slow - was 30 minutes between sitting down and the waitress taking my order. I ordered a simple burger and fries - Order took about 20 minutes to reach me, and was both mildly wrong (burger not cooked as ordered), covered in congealed plastic cheese, and with a very mean amount of fries (about 8 in total - so much for 'bottomless'). So, bad food and a lousy serving experience when the restaurant wasn't busy. Not up to standard, and won't be going back

This was a very disappointing experience. I ordered the Prime Rib Dip and the roll was very stale. At $13.99 I was expecting something of a much higher quality than just a burger. As for the "bottomless fries" I have yet to have them replenished in this location. The 9 or 10 fries that I got with my sandwich were pretty good though. Our waitress never came back to replenish either fries or drinks or to see how our food was for us. She did offer my husband another drink along with our check but we were more than ready to go by then. I will not return to this location, we'll hit the Five Guys right across the parking lot.

I have to say upfront that I love Red Robin as a general place. I love their bacon cheeseburgers and I adore their (unlimited) fries with sweet pepper thai dipping sauce. I have simple tastes, and Red Robin meets those tastes. This location was recently redone, and it looks really nice.  That being said, the service at this location is really hit and miss. I've had great servers there and terrible servers. Service can really make or break your experience at any restaurant, and I don't see a lot of consistency at this place. It may not be a fancy restaurant, but it's still my hard-earned money that I'm putting forth when I choose to dine out. It's not something I can afford to do very often. If I consistently got good service, my rating would be higher.

The staff looks like they've been rode hard and put away wet.  This location is alright. Came here when I was in high school about once a week, now its down to about once or twice a year.  My all time favorite RR meal is the Whiskey River BBQ burger- sub a garden patty *burnt* (I tell them to run it through the conveyor belt cooker 2-3x! Hockey puck status). Garden burgers are amazing. On my last visit I made the mistake of ordering wings. They were terrible. Awful. The Woodinville location has much better wings. My brothers Burnin' Love burger was ghastly (Gordon Ramsey), way way over seasoned. Not a very fun dinner. Glad to see they now offer a Happy Hour but their drinks are still pretty damn expensive.

I like their happy hour specials, especially the peach and strawberry margaritas.  Decided to give the Oktoberfest burger a shot - it looked great on the covers. We were pleased to see that the burger looked just as pictured. The taste - big disappointment. The patty was not as big, juicy or tasty, the lettuce was not fresh or crispy, the bun was dry and there was very little cheese or onion. The overall taste was bland and the fries with no salt or taste were not helping. I had to drink a lot of water and kind of forced fed myself to get it over with. Red Robin appetizers were good but their quality, burger tastes need to be wayyyy better for the price they charge. I might do a Red Robin if I am a part of a group who decides to go but I would not willingly go there for their food again. Maybe just the happy hour drinks but that's it.

Wow I can't believe I have not reviewed this restaurant. I have been going there since high school. I won't divulge for how many years.. Let's just say it is in the double digits and they used to serve fried zucchini sticks, chili burger, and pasta.  Now I go with my kiddo. The restaurant has not changed at all. It is in desperate need of updating.  The tables have residual grease from over the years.  Food is still decent. I appreciate the many choices of sides and fries. I also appreciate that they can make any burger with boca patty.  The last couple of times I went there the reward card computer was broken.  What is the point of rewards card if I can't redeem points and freebies.
Always a great experience. Love the burning love burger. Lots of options to choose from. Since I'm a vegetarian, they swap the patties as per my choice. Above all: Very friendly staff!

Ok so we eat here quite frequently.  I have to be gluten free or am sick.  RR is awesome about gluten allergies!  They know there stuff, have a separate fryer for the fries so it is safe for people who can't do gluten.  It makes me feel more relaxed knowing I can order and not worry I'll get sick after.  Rarely a mistake will happen with an order (life happens right?), if it does they are on it quickly courteously, and do something extra to make amends.  What more could you ask for?  Oh yeah - their food is good!  I've found this to be true at all the different RR I've visited over the years.  It remains my go to place for a burger!

I may be an anomaly but I consider Red Robin to be one of the best places for a vegetarian burger. While most places only offer the garden burger option, Red Robin can sub in a boca patty or a veggie patty in almost every burger on their menu. Their menu is flexible in many other ways as well - burger buns can be replaced by lettuce wraps and the variety they offer with salad dressings is incredible! Their food is pretty darn delicious too. Bottomless salted caramel milkshake, mmmmmm. The bleu cheese ribbon burger is delectable - mostly due to the delicious combination of bleu cheese with onion straws. And the endless garlic cheese fries, what a guilty pleasure! This particular Red Robin is filled with some really friendly servers who are ever patient with our boisterous, picky group of friends. In true fast food fashion, service is always prompt! Additionally, who doesn't love a restaurant thats open till 11pm?? Little tip : the endless baskets of fries actually run out around 10.45pm, make sure to order your fill by then!

My family and I have always eaten at this Red Robin for years. For the most part we've had a good experience, the staff has always been pleasant and attentive. Today, that was not the case. Our server  Hayley was dismissive and short with us, it may have been due to the restaurant being a little busier than usual but it's still no excuse to be impolite to your customers. Still, the service was not bad as she didn't have to do much. Just get our order and have someone bring it over. Well she even failed at this simple task as she spilled our drinks as she brought them and left without a word, leaving to clean her mess ourselves.  Though what irked my wife and I was when we ordered a meal to go for our kids. She seemed annoyed that we wanted something to go and had to jot down another order. We ordered a Burger(To be split in half) and two Vanilla Milkshakes.  Our order gets to us and the cups(about 16oz) are only a quarter full....and they charged us $4.99 for this(We had already paid for everything at this point). We complained to Hayley and told us that's "just the way they are" but that she would check in the Bar. She came back in less than a minute saying the Bartender told her "that's all they get now". We're obviously not happy but decided not to pursue it further since we didn't want them spitting in our food so we left. We get home and find the Burger wasn't split in half which we ended up doing ourselves but Also the Vanilla Milkshakes are actually Banana...so not only did we pay $10 for two milkshakes that wouldn't even fill up a zippy cup but it was also the wrong flavor. At this, I did call the manager about to complain. While today's experience was not indicative of our previous visits, it has definitely left us with a bad taste and we may need to consider a different Red Robin(as we love the food) even if it is a little further away.

Hostess was outgoing,  and delightful....service was extremely slow. Waited 10 minutes to be greeted,  another 15 that for our order. 3 tables around us got their food first. We ate our entire meal before we were checked back on.

I enjoyed a nice dinner with my fiance here during happy hour. It wasn't very crowded and our waiter was pretty awesome. I ordered the turkey baja club as a wrap - I didn't realize it was going to come out hot though so that was kind of strange. For happy hour none of the bottled beers are discounted so my Corona was more expensive than I was expecting. The $3.50 margarita on the other hand was a great deal and delicious. My fiance had a rum and coke and it was strong but the rum didn't taste very good. Pretty standard Red Robin but I found the staff here to be better than at other RRs. The kitchen was quick and the drinks were good. Our waiter even stopped by just before happy hour was over to see if we wanted another drink, which was quite nice of him. Not the best happy hour, but with good food and lack of crowd it's a good place to catch a bite after work.

Although I love Red Robin - my experience here with one of the servers was terrible. I've never been treated as poorly as I had with her. In all fairness - which is why I gave 2 stars instead of 1 - I do like their burger and food - I suggest going to the Lincoln Square one.

The food is wonderful and is what you expect from Red Robin's.  However, the restaurant is very busy and it is difficult to get good service. I was not offered additional fries and my water was not re-poured.  I think that the service is below par, but the food is absolutely delicious!

Gluten-free buns for $1 and will help you identify food safe for your diet. The server will mark your ticket "Allergy Alert" and that means extra cleaning of the grill, changes of gloves, and several steps of extra quality-control checking, usually including a manager "drop-by" to make sure that all is well. They make a little fuss to make sure that things are good for you without making you feel like a jerk, and they exercise good discretion in how much they communicate with you about it. Chances of being accidentally "glutened" once you make them aware: very low. Still, be careful about things that include soy sauce; that one's easy to overlook as a gluten ingredient.
I wish the crispy chicken salad had a little more for the price I pay. Totally not worse the price you pay. It cost way more than a burger for salad!!!! VERY DISAPPOINTED with their portion.

I remember this place being awesome when I was in high school and even a couple of years ago. But it's just gone down hill.  My dad and I went in to place a to go order. They had one person manning the bar. Yet several other servers were just hanging out by the drink station or hamming it up by the bathroom. Not sure what's so appealing with the bathroom. But nonetheless, this place is poorly managed and the food is just blah. I'm used to bad customer service coming from the DC area, but this is just sad for the NorthWest.  Needless to say we will not be coming back.  And our milkshakes...I'm pretty sure my son wasn't with us, but we damn sure got kiddie sized milkshakes. Total rip off. I almost cussed the girl out who made them, but I'm working on a better me.
same ol same ol burgers and fries

The food is relatively consistent with any other Red Robin I have been to--ie, pretty good for chain food and our go-to for an easy burger. But we don't have kids and I HATE getting automatically seated in the bar every time we try to eat here, even when the restaurant isn't all that busy. Although this location is closer to home, we'll go to Bellevue Square or Redmond Town Center from now on.

Like I've said before, I like my burgers super flavorful--why would I want to eat a bland burger? The burgers on the menu sound really good, and really promising. So the last time we came here to eat, I ordered the peppercorn burger, because I've tried a similar burger elsewhere and it was SO GOOD. However, the burger I received was kind of small, and it wasn't as flavorful as I had hoped. Dare I say it... It was actually a bit too bland for me. I was slightly disappointed, but Red Robin has bottomless fries, so that is a definite plus. I might come here again, because I want to try their other burgers, and also because I've tried their banzai burger and burning love burger, both of which are actually really good. So all hope is not lost. I still like this place. It's a great place to hang out with friends and maybe grab a beer in the bar area.

So, we all know what we're gonna get at Red Robin, whatever the location, but I have to give a big shout-out to this one.  Went this past Sunday, arrived with a party of 7, about 4.50pm.  Place was very quiet, we were starving and expected to get eating real soon.  Things went down hill very fast, not being served, eventually placing orders for apps and drinks that never arrived and we were ticked off.  Things went even more downhill from there, but hooray for Davina (?) the manager.  She came out, put things right, food arrived/was delicious/devoured in record time :)  It's great to see a manager doing their job, and she was brilliant.  Sad that the service hecked up, maybe they were just having a bad day but nice to find a place that cared about customer service.

Short version: average food, far less than average service.  If you want red robin, go to a different location. Long version:  We all know what to expect coming I to a red robin as far as the quality of the food is concerned. It's mediocre, affordable burgers, fries and other American classics. If you want the best burger of your life, you should know by now a big chain isn't gonna do it, and if they did, you need to stop eating out so darn much and ask grandma to make you a burger.  The food was exactly as expected. Nothing amazing, nothing terrible (however, my fish and chips were dripping grease, but that's what I get for ordering fish and chips at a burger place). What irritated me most was the service.  The waitress was friendly enough, smiling and whatnot, but i don't think she knew what she was doing. Even though she was training another girl, I'm not sure she'd ver been trained.  Here are some gripes I had with my experience here yesterday written as tips for the waitstaff: 1 Bring out plates with the appetizers. 2 Do not stack plates of food on top of each other when bringing entrees to customers. 3 When you bring out entrees, and there is nothing left of the appetizer, clear those plates, especially if the customer has to stack things to make entrees fit. 4 Your employer advertises bottomless fries. Don't let a customer sit there for 10+ minutes without any before your manager happens to walk by and ask if they want more.  I would have been satisfied with the service if only one or 2 of those things happened, but when it all happens and there's 3 occupied tables in your section (I went at 2-ish pm. Not peak eating time) something's gotta give. I do not recommend this location.

Came in late Thursday night with my wife.  My wife was craving fish and we thought we'd be too late to get to Ivar's and I recalled that the fish sandwiches at Red Robin were pretty tasty, so we stopped in. I ordered the fish sandwich and my wife got the fish and chips.  It took some time for our waiter to get around to us, he apologized and attributed the delay to a group of 10 or so high school students, who were trying to pay individually.  Another server had brought our water over.  My wife has sensitive teeth, but I had forgotten to ask for water with no ice for her.  I tried to get the attention of the server, saying excuse me and waving my arms but he just kept walking to the back. The waiter finally came back with our order and I asked him if we could get a glass of water without ice, and after 5 minutes he brought it over.  My fish was a bit bland and had very little tarter on the bun, and I had forgotten to ask for extra tarter sauce for my fries. My wife was complaining to me that her fish didn't seem quite cooked enough, and asked if mine was the same.  I didn't think so, I told her, but I was so hungry at that point, I'm not sure I'd even notice.  She continued to eat, but I still needed some tarter for my bland fish. I tried to get the waiter's attention, as he looked right at me, then made a left turn to take a different route.  At first I thought he was assisting another customer, when after several minutes of not seeing him emerge, my informed me that he was back in the kitchen area, and that there were no customers in the section he had travelled. He had deliberately avoided me!   I got up and walked back to the prep area, looking around and opening a cooler cabinet, when the waiter came over to me and asked if he could help me.  I told him he could have helped me 10 minutes ago, when I was trying to get some more tarter sauce, but it appeared I was going to have help myself.  He said he would bring it out.  He didn't even offer an apology.     My wife told me she wanted some ketchup for her fries and then I realized that he didn't even offer to bring us any.  I got tired of waiting for him and got up to another table to get some. The waiter came back and asked if we wanted some more fries, and I said yes.  He hadn't walked 10 feet before coming back, and asked "Did you say you wanted more fries?'   I said again yes.  I asked my wife, if I was talking to low that perhaps he didn't hear me.  She said I she understood perfectly well, and she was further away than the waiter. After dropping $30 bucks and such bad service I'd have to say we won't be back again, and probably not eat at Red Robin any more as a result.  I know it's a chain and I would hope other locations are better, but I'm not going to be saying Red Robin......................yum, anytime soon.
#mike gave us all great service and really made our red robin experience awesome!!! He was funny and seemed very helpful to Aaron!

It's Red Robin. Not great, not terrible. What really gets me about this place, though, is that they don't take reservations. As a restaurant that bills itself as family- and group-friendly, one would expect them to be able to accomodate large groups, especially since it's a hotspot for kids birthdays. Not the case. I've come here twice on a team lunch, and since we were unable to make reservations, we end up standing around for 20+ minutes while the hosts blink blankly and look around, as if they're hoping some large tables will appear. Last time was the last straw, as they let us stand in the lobby for the requisite 20 minutes while waiting for a table large enough to open up, meanwhile seating smaller parties ahead of us - and finally decided to break us up into smaller parties and seat us in booths. If that was the solution, couldn't we have done that without the wait?  I don't have anything to say about the food, as it's fine. It's the service that's subpar. If you don't take reservations and present yourself as a good place for groups, then be able to actually take care of groups!

Their yelp account says midnight, and their door has no closing hours written. We walked in exactly at eleven. Stood there for ten minutes, multiple employees saw us, but no one told us they were closed till after we stood there in the waiting area for those 10+ minutes. Great customer service...
Just like the rest of Red Robin Restaurants,  the burger was good and the service was good.  The place was clean but nothing special at all.

We decided to try this location on a Friday night and we settled in at the main bar. The speed of service, accuracy, attentiveness, and quality of food was unimpressive. The bar staff was not exceptionally busy at the time either. We split a clucks and shrimp basket which was overpriced at $12.99. A total of 2 medium mediocre chicken strips and 6 tiny pieces of shrimp. I had to immediately order a different bottomless fry because they gave it to me COLD, not even the slightest bit warm. Save your time and money go to DQ or Ivars first instead. Then come here for drinks. We left still hungry and disappointed. At least the bartender was on the ball with my blended cocktail.

Two visits; one a second chance visit. Decidedly unimpressed. The burgers are just barely larger than sliders, and they seem to think they are solid gold. Service slow, sloppy, poor, inattentive, and their "bottomless" fries took so long to get any more of, I just hit bottom.  Their prices are ludicrous for the quality, quantity, and service. Two local taverns have FAR better burgers: top burger in the area: Daman's. Second best: MugShots Burgers and Brew; both are far superior in meat quality, size, flavor, service, and value.  Unless I have an overwhelming urge to throw away money, I will not be back to a Red Robin.
Good service, good food, good price This chain is always a decent stop for a good burger. Nice atmosphere, friendly people. Red Robin will always be a place to go for me.

WARNING!  They have DRASTICALY Change their menu! Gone - French Onion Soup, Just-in-Quesadilla just to name a few. Red Robin has always had a very limited menu for me, since I'm not a fan of low quality beef.  So normally when we go here I would get a cup of French Onion soup and a 1/2 order of the Quesadillas.  Last Friday night we stopped in at 5:55pm just skirting under the happy hour time. But no wait staff was around to help. I got up to ask the hostess, which were obviously poorly trained in customer service. Too young to understand that the customer pays your wages!!!  When I asked them nicely just to help me get a server before the 6pm time I literally got a no. Really? NO? Nothing we can go for you if it's past 6pm. It's not, hello?  Management desperately needs to send these kids back to school.  Anyway... When I got back to the table luckily a server had arrived and took our happy hour order just in the nick of time.  Then I finally had a chance to look at the new menu.  EVERYTHING that I normally eat was GONE. What bean counter decided to take off the most popular item on the appetizer menu?  Our happy hour mushrooms arrived, YUCK, swimming in oil and undercooked at the same time.  And who serves fried mushrooms with chili sauce? ewwww.  Our happy hour drinks arrived, probably the smallest $7 margarita on the planet. Not really a deal??? We ended up ordering entrees that we've had before.  They were fine, but ended up upsetting both of our stomachs later. In the end, we were treated poorly, small portions and HIGH prices. We will no longer be going to Red Robin.

Chophouse burger with a tower of onion rings and Red Robin ranch dressing, that my friend is heaven on earth. When you have great servers like Wayne from Ohio to serve it to you your all set. I actually make a point to sit somewhere ( like outside where it's hot instead of inside with the AC ) that I don't want to to have him wait on us. Great service. Fabulous food. Reasonable prices. Rewards card. I'm in. YUMMM.....

I am pretty sure all I do is eat Red Robin. Is that a bad thing? For my waist line, yes. But the food is good! Just because its a chain, doesn't mean the food can't be good. I am not a fan of chain burger places. I hate Applebee's, and Chili's, and not a huge fan of TGIF. But Red Robin is delicious!  I will definitely agree with Allie S. that the fries here are kinda hit or miss. But this location, it was a hit for me! I always order my fries extra crispy, and this location got it right the first time! Which never happens. They needed a little bit more salt, but nothing a little ranch dressing couldn't help.  My new favorite burger at RR is the Blue Ribbon Burger, which I ordered here. We also had just joined the Red Robin Royalty program, so we got a free appetizer. And after we order 9 burgers, the 10th one is free. I am not usually a fan of those programs, because I don't eat there enough, but this one seemed worth it to me. We got the Onion Rings and Mozzarella sticks. I already knew that I loved the onion rings here, but OMG the Mozzarella sticks are heavenly. I love fried cheese, how have I never tried these before?!?!?!?  We filled up on the appetizers, so we took most of our burgers home for left overs. And it was still very good warmed up the next day. We went there at 7 pm on a Friday night, and expected to have to wait, but this location was huge, so we were seated right away, which was awesome. I am like a toddler, and hate waiting. Our Server was great too, we always had refills for our drinks, and he got us a box for our leftovers, and didn't seem to mind us sitting there letting our food digest for awhile after finishing dinner. My only complaint was that the appetizer came out, and like 5 minutes later our food came out, which meant we were trying to eat all of it at once, and I was afraid my burger would get cold, and I felt rushed. But in the end, it all worked out!

I visited this Red Robin at the request of a coworker, I'm not generally fond of chain restaurants in the style of Friday's or Bennigan's. At least my expectations were set properly. The service was attentive, the walls filled with plasticky garish (what they were going for, I imagine.) I ordered the mac & cheese with side salad and a chocolate malt. The portions of both were big, which was nice, but while I couldn't finish my meal, I had little interest in taking it back with me. The "four" cheeses seemed to be a bland, rubbery cheddar strung on top, the blue cheese salad dressing was fair, but too salty. I felt up to my gills in brine from everything but the malt. I appreciate that it's a local chain, but if I'm going to pay ~15$ for an entree and drink, I'd expect slightly better than bland microwaved-from-a-bag product. Hell, Kraft is better. When you make Friday's look tasteful and healthy by comparison, something is amiss.

this red robin is the best out of all locations. The menu has changed, but in a good way. It seems like corporate is trying to update which i LOVE. The servers are amazing and are always super friendly and helpful no mater how busy they are. And the food is amazing inculding the ddb (damn good burger) AMAZZZZINNNGGG I highly recomment coming to visit this location. you can meet your future best friend/server here!!!

While it's a chain and I usually am not the biggest fan of chains I do like Red Robin. I've never been to a Red Robin that was bad. The burgers are good, the fries are nice and the service is usually pretty friendly. Yes the burger is a bit pricer then other places but they are usually pretty good (I like that they let you have your burger cooked with a little pink in the middle).

I'm SHOCKED at how many Red Robins there are in the Bellevue/Washington area. Red Robin is a oldie but a goodie for us. We enjoy it. Is it super special and unique? Nope. But can you always plan on having a good burger, fries, and a drink? You sure can!

The burgers are delicious, I'm not going to lie. It's difficult to find good burgers around here...and this is our fall back place for lunch or dinner. Most of the time, the fries are over-seasoned. I don't really like a lot of seasoning. Sometimes they are just perfect and other times I can't eat them.  A word of advice: Unless you like the sound of yelling, giggling teenagers, do NOT go on a Friday night. Made that mistake once...it didn't make me mad because I remember what it was like to be out with friends having fun on the weekends, but now when I go with my family, the noise level is overwhelming. The waiters are pretty inattentive. We had our waiter apologize to us for not coming around AT ALL because it was his cousin's birthday (table of teenagers) and it was his job to make sure they had a fun time. Okay, yes, but that table was not your only table. We still gave him a good tip...why, I have no idea. Probably because we were embarrassed to leave less than $5 and our bill was around $28.  If you go to this location on weekday nights or during the day on the weekend, the experience is MUCH better.

Came Sunday afternoon 2:30PM with my wife and daughter as we were hungry, after wating 15 min I tried to get the waiter's attention as we didnt get any drinks, looks like no one cares, At first I thought they assisting another customer, when after several minutes of not seeing anyone emerge, other customers came after us already order and got there drinks and water, looks like they deliberately avoided us. My wife was so upset  The waiter never came to take our order  we left after waiting 25 Min there. I use to go Redmond town center one sometime for lunch, they seems Ok     On the way I was telling my wife that Red Robin is voated as bedt kid friendly restaurant I saw in some magazine.. No sure how :-( or unless it's paid... I told manager she offered a quick to go food , but my wife was so upset we left..  I'd have to say we won't be back again, and probably not eat at Red Robin any more as a result even in Redmond Town center one.

Every time I come to this place they get my sons order wrong and he's the only reason why we come here. He has dairy and gluten allergies. Most recent time was yesterday and they put cheese on his burger when I said he has dairy allergies as well as gluten. I had no idea until I asked him how his burger was and he said good, it has cheese too! I quickly took it from him and told the waitress when she finally came back that he has a diary allergy and there's cheese on his burger. I barely got an apology out of it and they gave him another burger. The check came and I was thinking they would take his dinner off as a way to make the situation right and they didn't. Usually if there is an issue like this the manager would pop over and make sure things were okay considering my son ate 1/4th of the burger. Nope! The visit before they put his burger on a regular bun and the visit before that they didn't have gluten free buns. Won't be coming back to this location. Red robin has gone downhill in service for sure!
My "keep it simple" garden burger was very interesting. Asked for grilled onions and ranch/honey mustard for fry dipping. Yum

This place is a frequent place for lunch. Its always crowded but the wait staff makes you feel like you are a priority. The food always comes just in time, the portions changed but I noticed that at every Red Robin. My favorite thing to get is the Caesar Salad Wrap.

My son & I were starving and came here. They sat us at a really small table and I hate them small tables, so we moved. I find it interesting that they give the  nutritional values menus to the food.
