WoW! But we still ate here. I had some kind of sliders, 3 of them and there were tasty. I like the fries here also. The ice tea was ok, they have the yellow stuff. My kid likes the strawberry lemon aide, and it is bottomless.  The waiter was friendly too.

For a chain, they're pretty good. I give them 2 stars, but in all honesty, I eat here quite a bit and have been to this particular Red Robin at least a dozen times, and I'll keep coming back, it's just that there a lot of better places out there. First of all, for the main course, I only come here for burgers. For the price, I consider them to be a great value (which is what keeps me coming back). Every so often they have new burgers on special, so those are a nice treat, especially if you're someone who tires of the same menu. They also offer them with "some pink in the middle", as they don't use the terminology medium rare. So they actually come out well done or medium most of the time. It's also impossible to leave here hungry, with their bottomless fries. Although, once I asked for sweet potatoe fries, and they came out cold and as it looked like they had been sitting out for a while. Still, I ate them, as I was curious if perhaps I had a bad batch. So, after my plate was empty, I noticed the water walking by several times without asking me if I wanted more. It seems they are less hesitant to give you more fries if you order the sweet potatoe fries... oh well. I did end up getting another round of them, and they weren't any better. So, stick with their normal bottomless fries.

Wow, what a zoo at noontime on a Friday.   Despite the crowds we were seated and served very quickly.  I had the Prime RIb Dip sandwich that came with steak fries and coleslaw. And despite the mega-corporate image of Red Robin, I have to say the Prime Rib Dip and coleslaw were excellent.  Loved the dill tarter sauce that came with the fries. Menu is somewhat limited:  salads, sandwiches, burgers and pasta.

Their happy hour deals are great - $2.50 wells and select drafts, $3.50 "specialty" drafts and gold margaritas.  Honestly you will be hard pressed to find drinks with prices lower than this in Redmond/Bellevue.  We can usually go here on a Friday afternoon after work, have 2 drinks each and a wrap or burger, and get out for under $40. Their burgers are fine, not the best by any stretch, but food comes out quick and is satisfying.  The service at this location is usually better than the RTC location, and certainly better than the Issaquah location. Food is probably 3 stars, happy hour is a 5, service is about a 4.  So 4 stars overall sounds about right.

I've been to Red Robin twice - both here in Redmond. The burgers are good and the service relatively fast. The bartender was very attentive while I waited for my to-go order. If there was one convenient to my home, I'd certainly stop in occasionally. Unfortunately, the one they're building in Gainesville is connected to the mall, so not likely to see me there.
Jalepeno coins and new fiery burger is awesome. Great happy hours deals

I love them bottomless fries. Its a good place to satisfy your hunger when you really crave that fries. The place is very centrally located and has outdoor seating as well. Taking Washington state's weather I think its better to be seated inside unless you really want to play truth or dare with Mother Nature.

Not sure what makes this Red Robin go bob-bob-bobbin' along. Disclaimer: my son used to work at different Red Robin locations, from Puyallup to San Diego to Del Mar. I've eaten my fair share of burgers and imbibed Flat on Your Beaks up and down the coast. This location was the worst of any burger joint, much less a Red Robin, that I've eaten at. Maybe it was an off night. I can only hope so. Details: Steak fries and onion straws were slightly underdone. The meat in my burger was split in half and an attempt had been made to glue it together with cheese. I'm a big fan of cheese as glue, but this was a burger that should've been consumed by a staffer in the back room, not sent to a paying customer. Because it was split, one half kept falling out. Minus three stars for this alone! Birthday songs at these kinds of places are ubiquitous. Usually, I like looking around to see who the birthday person is and enjoy the staff trying to drum up enthusiasm for whatever birthday song their company makes them sing.  This time, however, the song went on for quite a while, such that our waiter never came back to see how we were doing. After our food was dropped onto our table, we didn't see him again until he appeared with our bill...not even bothering to ask if we wanted anything else (which we did). He did re-do the bill with our newly requested item, but where's the service in that? Also: malteds were low on malt. A real bummer. In any case, there's too many other burger places in town for me to go back to this location again. Ever.

The Souper Sandwich combo with French Onion Soup and the BLTA Croissant. Order it. That's all you need to know -- it's the pinnacle, as good as it gets here. If you're really hungry, order the BLTA with fries and get a side of the soup. Sometimes, I come here just for soup, but I'm the kind of person who will probably kiss your feet for some good French Onion. Don't miss the soup! The fries are generally hit or miss based on freshness, but when you get them hot and fresh from the fryer, there are few fries that go better with mayo and ketchup. Yes, it's a chain. But the food ain't bad.

The food is just what you expect (chain restaurants tend to be the same everywhere) but this particular location, more often than not I've been unhappy with the service.  The last time I was there the service made me downright angry, regarding a difference between what they told us we would be charged when I asked and what we actually were charged when the bill came. So, I've decided there's no reason to go to this location any more when there's another Red Robin 10-15 minutes in every direction.

Went for happy hour with friends....they no longer have happy hour.  So far only Overlake, but rest of red robin will follow!  The best deal in town just became one of the worst!  We used to come weekly, no more!!!  Limited menu with only 1 wine on the "special". Bad decision corporate.

Went here for lunch yesterday.  Typical Red Robin - nothing to write home about. I ordered a Diet Coke and asked for it with a lemon in it.  Diet Coke came, no lemon - grrr... I had a Banzai Burger.  It was not really that warm, and the patty wasn't a patty, but a broken up patty.  Grr again. It was crowded as all hell in there, but that's what you get for going there at noon (my friend's suggestion, not a time I would pick because that is when EVERYONE goes to lunch - earlier or later - smarter). I ordered the Mac & Cheese for my son.  It was surprisingly good.  I would almost say it was better than my burger. Bottomless fries?  Um, not so much.  The waitress didn't bring her A game to our table that day.  Service was sub par.  My friend paid though.  Hopefully he tipped appropriately.

It's Red Robin. All of their burgers are outstanding and their chicken sandwich's are also very good. This place is great for kids and you get unlimited steak fries. The Mint Brownie Shake is the best shake they have.
Food is always good.  Service is typically outstanding. We eat here once a week :)

I want to preface this review by saying that I really do like Red Robin.  I don't expect that I am going to be eating a gourmet meal and have the best customer service experience of my life... but, really??? First of all, our waitress was less than enthused to be serving me and my 3 friends.  I don't blame her - if I was working as a waitress I would have those nights too.  But, she was MISERABLE!  The night started off with us ordering drinks.  Two of my friends ordered margaritas and me and another ordered a simple diet coke.  My friends with the margs got them after 10 minutes, clearly filled too much and spilling everywhere.  There wasn't even alcohol in one of them.  We also noticed that the waitress didn't check our IDs.  My friends and I, by no means, look remotely old enough to be drinking. The Diet Cokes arrived after another 5 minutes or so.  When we ordered our food, our waitress got verbally impatient because one of my friends was debating between 2 meals.  The server that brought our food out to us didn't even know what the meals were.  He literally said "I think this is a...uh...cheeseburger?"  REALLY?? After we finished our meal and drinks, we waited another 30 minuted for the waitress to bring us our checks and another 20 minutes for her to take them.  It was insane. I will return to Red Robin again, just never again at this location.  I was appalled by the customer service!

I  barely can give our experience 1 star rating!  The restaurant was filthy...including the restrooms!  Even the vases, counters, etc...were dusty and dirty! The receptionist kept mixing up the names and numbers of guests on the wait list.  After  20 min of watching others go ahead of us, we asked what was going on....They were rude and said they were "working on it."  We could see many empty tables that were not cleared and cleaned, so guests could not be seated...slow & sloppy table service!  IF we had not had 2 very tired and hungry children, we would have moved on.  When we were finally seated at a table with a dirty floor and sticky bench, the waitress asked if she could get the kids order in first to get their food out asap.  We did that, but our adult order still came almost 5 min before the kids...a long wait for children!  Water was never brought to the table...we had to ask.   The food was Red Robin and we enjoyed it!  BUT...when our bill arrived, we had been charged for an extra glass of wine and it needed to be adjusted.  We have been going to Red Robin Restaurants for many years, but it was such a bad experience and atmosphere, that we will not be back!  The ONLY reason for a 1 star...the food was as expected AND our waitress did the very best she could!  She was very apologetic for such slow service...that was a kitchen issue!  She tried and was very nice!

Was served great. I received what I ask for. Although RR isn't that cheap, the burger was still large enough to satisfy. I think they also give you free refills. When I drank the entire cup of soda, I was given another one before I even noticed! Thanks

It's those times when you're going out to a "nice lunch" away from work that you wish you had more sushi fanatics on your team than you do. But I won't hold my teammates' impression of a "nice lunch" against Red Robin. Standard disclaimer applies - I don't really eat beef, so I get to browse the chicken portion of the menu (though they have a decent selection of turkey burgers, which is nice). The food is OK, but not great. It's a restaurant that suffers from over-glamorous images on its menus. Everything looks good, but then you order something, and it actually looks... lackluster? Lifeless? As though they've been languishing under a heat lamp for too long? (I needed another L word.) Since I know the burgers are decent, I will suggest this place if there are red meat eaters in the group. But I don't exactly crave it.

Great burger chain. I go there when I feel a need for unlimited steak fries and their Whiskey river burger, I go with the grilled chicken variety, covered in bbq sauce, cheddar cheese, and crispy onion straws. I am also fond of their chicken strips and their chicken ceaser salad varieties.The strawberry lemonade is good to. It is mainly a burger joint, but they have salads, pastas, appetizers, and they are always coming up with some new concoction. They also have a full bar, though I have not been thrilled with their cocktail-making skills. Shakes are great though.  P.s. always clean, and friendly efficient service.  P.p.s. Might want to avoid on a friday or saturday evening, filled with kids and teens. Unless you like that kind of thing. And there is always the bar section where kids are not allowed.
The service is great, and the food both good and consistent. I'd consider myself a regular.
For a chain, this place has some pretty good burgers. I usually order the banzai burger and dust it in a matter of minutes. Service is decent at this location. It really depends on when you visit.
I would give the service on 148th's  Red Robin five stars, these guys are realy looking out for you. The food is good as it gets for a big chain .. I love going there.

I know... It's Red Robin. What can you really say that people don't already know? I'm just going to give you guys a list of what I like. The bar is always easy seating. The service is pretty fast considering how busy they get. The fries are excellent. The french onion soup is awesome. The burgers are great, but the BLTA is my favorite. Oh, and did I mention the fries? A hint, if you call in an order to go, you can ask for extra fries and they'll fill a whole 'nother box of fries for you at no charge since they're unlimited when you eat in the restaurant.  I love it!!
I had a holiday party here. They were very hospitable and moved tons of tables around for us. Ordering was a breeze.

When I was really really little, like nursery school age, my babysitter was a little old British lady who lived two doors up from us. She had a day-care that me and a bunch of other neighborhood kids would be contained at while our parental units were working. I have very few memories of this place, but all were happy and innocent. For example, I remember all of us pointing out airplanes as they flew overhead, or helicopters, and being in total amazement that something like that could fly. I remember playing cowboys and indians, and I remember a little girl from up the street that I had a crush on. She had the most awesome little black curls. I also remember making mud pies in the sandbox with a little shovel, pie tin and a pail of water. The mud pies looked so good (I was an early fan of chocolate), and I remember trying to eat one. Well... mud doesn't taste so good, but hey that's the kind of thing you learn when you're like 3 years old or whatever I was. I just ate at Red Robin. I might as well have eaten a mud pie. The food is sitting in me like I swallowed a big rock or something. It tasted ok, but cripes can someone help me find a bran muffin or something?

Faster than a Bennigans, More powerful than a Ruby Tuesdays, and able to leap tall Applebees in a single bound..... Seriously...nothing more than the  perfect basic Chicken Sandwich... Bread Mayo Lettuce Tomato Chicken Onion Pickles Mayo  Bread Now that is how you build it. Fresh Toppings, Sesame Bun, and Juicy Chicken. Under $10 with a shareable size of fries....oh yeah, they serve beer,wine, & liquor....Like a Wendy's on HGH. The rest of the food is about hundred ways to prepare a Burger(Beef,Chicken, or Veggie) and assorted sandwiches, wraps, entrees, and salads.....but just order a burger...You don't go to a Pet Store for a lawnmower do you? RR is apparently the next step up the little-kid birthday venue from Chuck-e-Cheese....I am not sure how pimple-faced teenagers singing you a birthday song is better than a giant mouse... I guess I am not ready for that step yet....

RED ROBIN HAS GREAT FOOD!! I JUST WISH THEY COULD FIND DECENT HELP AT THIS LOCATION!  I would rather DIE than have these bastard sons and daughters of rich trouser stains screw up my order again!!! I am tired of Bellevue's children ignoring me because there parents decided that biff or Buffy needed to get a job and learn some responsibility before they sign over there trust funds. IT'S ANNOYING AND IT'S SHOWING BELLEVUE!! STOP IT!!!! My husband and I work hard in this town to earn a decent living, and deserve to get some decent customer service in this town!! DOES THIS NO LONGER EXIST?

It's Red Robin.  It's burgers.  They're a step up from fast food and some lower end places (Applebees, Dennys, etc) but I feel they're expensive for what you get, even if the fries are bottomless.  We go when we're not sure what else to do or want to eat after 10pm.

This is one of the best Red Robin Locations.  I would give this slightly more that a 3 star but it doesnt warrent a 4 star review.  I go here because there is always a choice for everyone and it is great for kids.

I'm usually impressed by this location, especially since the wait is usually small (both with seating and food arrival).  But the last three times we went, we felt like someone forgot us.  Once we got left with empty plates until our server came back from his break, once we were given our meals without drinks (no lube, no good!) and once the meal just took forever.  We always order the same thing, so we have to conclude the variety in the wait depends on the time of day. Four stars because the food is good, fast, easy, and the people are nice.
Can't go wrong with any Whiskey River BBQ items - burger, chicken, or wrap! I've always had great service at this RR and I'll keep going back.

There are things I do, and don't, like about Red Robin. The biggest thing I don't like is how crazy busy they are! No matter what time you go here, seems like it's always a zoo. And even if the place isn't packed, you don't really get any feel of privacy in this place. It's always noisy and fast paced. The drinks are very good - from non-alcoholic beverages like the strawberry lemon-aid, to their alcoholic beverages - but they are way over priced!  The burgers are good, with a wide selection (the swiss mushroom is my fav) but if you are going with your friends, and you aren't a burger person, your choices will be limited. For what you get, I don't think the burgers are overpriced; just the drinks. Service a lot of times is slow, and your waiter or waitress can be hard to find in the mess of all the other tables.  I like their food, but not really big on the experience.

This Red Robin's location has been here for years. I grew up in this area and while there are a lot of restaurants now, pre-Microsoft campus, this area was kind of out in the boonies...there were literally horse farms in this area people! RR was pretty much all we had. I've been coming here with my parents as long as I can remember and for that reason this location has a special place in my heart. The food here isn't going to win any culinary awards or anything, but it's mighty tasty. I don't care how much of a foodie you are, you gotta give it up for the Robin Bacon Burger and all-you-can-eat steak fries. The BBQ Chicken Wrap is also a winner in my opinion.

I am so torn on this review.... we go to this Red Robin every year for mine and my friend's birthday.... and we have pretty good service.. this year however, we hit some snags.  I called and made a reservation for 24 and specifically asked if we could sit in the atrium area.  We have a pretty large group and its the only place in the restaraunt that would fit all of us comfortably.  Upon arrival, the table wasnt ready, and even 15-20 mins after it wasnt ready.  They asked if we wanted to move our party to the outside seating area that is heated and quieter.  Ok, we thought we would give it a try.   It is a nice area, and the fact that we could hear each other was nice, and it was perfectly heated.  The downside, you can never get your waitress' attention, because she is actually inside and you are not. She was really efficent with drinks and getting our orders right, but the service took forever.  And again, when you need a refill, you cannot get her attention because she isnt near you.  They brought all 20 of our orders out at once which was cool, so that we could all eat at the same time and be finished at the same time, it was a parade of waitress'/waiters and trays.  And having seperate checks is always hard I know, so she only got one wrong and charged one girl twice. And the other good thing, when you leave from the outer area, you dont have to go through the entire place, it was nice just to walk to your car.
Good burgers and decent service, when its "on". Rest of fare and menu are pretty typical chain restaurant fare though...pretty greasy.

its the dirty bird its gonna be good only thing is a lot of the stuff on the menu is pretty fatty but good atmosphere waitresses are nearly always super nice and cute. not always the case with the guys that is the nice part. i am disappointed that they buffalo style clucks n fry's have changed that drippy read sauce is no longer on them idk what it is but not nearly as good. just lookout on friday nights during high school football season it sucks unless your in high school they are everywhere. no seating!!

It is standard Red Robin fare.  I have had both really bad experiences at this location, and really good ones.  So I guess it averages out.  The staff is either kind and attentive or extremely slow and non-existent.  The food is the same as every other RR nothing fantastic but decent.  I don't know what else to say it is RR.

My kids think this place is medium at best. Now that they're a wee bit older the novelty has worn off and the lack of reputable service is more apparent to them. The food arrives quickly but is inconsistent in quality and accuracy.  Service is hit or miss with it usually being a miss. We are very "good" customers as I waited tables through college and I get it. However, the majority of the wait staff here are more interested in the daily gossip of their co-workers than the contentment of their patrons. If I'm going out to eat, I'm willing to spend money, so please, just ask me if I want something else before the uncontrollable urge to put down my check in front of me becomes unbearable!
